attributes.action: Introduce new regulations to the online dating industry that makes it compulsory for all sites to implement an approved anti fraud system for CNP (Card Not Present) transactions as well as an approved anti phishing system.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Figures released by the UK payment association Apacs showed 2008's total card losses stood at £609.9m, more than half of which was CNP fraud.  Dating websites do not currently have to implement any anti fraud systems. This makes it incredibly easy for scammers to monetise stolen card details through CNP transactions.  Dating sites are not currently required to implement anti phishing scams which costs the UK millions of pounds every year making dating websites without these measures a haven for scammers.
